title: As a BOC User, I want to receive an email if a Club attempts to check in an underage player
custom_preconds:
Given BOC and Club user logs into AMT
AND a prospect player doesn't meet the age requirement
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to check in that player
custom_expected:
THEN Club users should be prevented from checking in player who do not meet the age requirement
AND When this error is triggered, AMT will send an Email to BOC Users
AND Text of email to be provided

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Eligibility+to+Enter+Club+Facilities
Related to:
https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/163433189

title: As a BOC User, I want to receive an email if a Club attempts to check in an Overdue player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club user logs in to AMT
AND a prospect player is Overdue
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to check in that player
custom_expected:
THEN Club users should be prevented from checking in player who is Overdue
AND When this error is triggered, AMT will send an Email to BOC Users
AND Text of email to be provided

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Prospect+Statuses

Related to:
https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/163605386

title: As a BOC User, I want to receive an email when a Club submits a Travel Authorization Form
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user logs into AMT
custom_steps: WHEN user submits a Travel Authorization form to BOC
custom_expected:
THEN the system should send an email to BOC Users
AND If a Form is in Rejected state, and the Club resubmits the Form to the BOC, the system will send an email to BOC Users
AND Text of email to be provided


Related to:
https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/161763813

title: As a Club User, I want to receive an email when the status of one of my Club's Travel Authorization Forms is Updated
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs into AMT
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user Approves  submitted Travel Authorization Form
OR BOC user Rejects submitted Travel Authorization Form
custom_expected:
THEN the system should send an email to users of the Club that submitted the Form
AND Text of email to be provided


Related to:
https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/161764860
https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/161764887

title: As an AMT User, I want to receive emails if a Checked In player becomes Approaching
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user log into AMT
custom_steps: WHEN a Checked In player becomes Approaching because he is nearing his checked in day limit
custom_expected:
THEN the system will send an email to users of the Club where he is checked in AND BOC Users
AND These emails will be generated every day until he is checked out
AND Text of email to be provided

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Prospect+Statuses

title: As an AMT User, I want to receive emails if a Checked In player becomes Overdue
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club user logs into AMT
custom_steps: WHEN a Checked In player becomes Overdue because he has reached his checked in day limit
custom_expected:
THEN the system will send an email to users of the Club where he is checked in AND BOC Users
AND These emails will be generated every day until he is checked out
AND Text of email to be provided

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Prospect+Statuses

title: BOC user wants to send Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and attempting to Send a Request Bulletin
AND "Send Emails" is set to "YES"
AND "Send Notification" is checked off under "Request Bulletin" for BOC and Club users
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result bulletin with "Send Notification" selected for the Org(s) that have Request Bulletin - Send Notification selected
AND All entered waiver requests should be included in this email
AND Subject of the emails should be "mm/dd/yyyy Wvr Req Bulletin" with the Request Date displayed
AND Top of email should display (with proper bulletin #and dates populated):
     -MLB - Waiver Request Bulletin
     -Bulletin #1003353 Mon 08/15/2016
     -Claim period expires Wed 08/17/2016
AND Format of each request should be:
     -Type - Requesting Org
     -Player Last, Player First Middle Initial. - POS - MLS: 0.000
     -Last TX: (as displayed on bulletin in system)
AND Bottom of email should contain:  "ALL WAIVER INFORMATION IS TO REMAIN STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL. DO NOT FORWARD THIS INFORMATION. VIOLATIONS MAY RESULT IN FINES OR OTHER DISCIPLINE. End of Bulletin*"

title: BOC user wants to send Waiver Result Bulletin to BOC users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and attempting to send a Waiver Result Bulletin
AND Send Emails" is set to "YES"
AND  "Send Notification" is checked off under "Result Bulletin" for BOC users
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Result Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result bulletin with "Send Notification" selected for BOC that have Result Bulletin - Send Notification selected. All non-cancelled Waiver Requests will be included
AND Subject of the emails should be "mm/dd/yyyy Wvr Res Bulletin" with the Request Date displayed
AND Top of email should display (with proper bulletin #and dates populated):
-MLB - Waiver Result Bulletin
-BOC Version (All Clubs) 
AND Format of each result should be:
-Player Last, Player First M.I. - Type (TRD)
-{Waiver Result}
AND if player was not claimed, Waiver Result should match what is displayed on the Results section for BOC (ex: Secured through end of the Championship Season)
AND If player was claimed, then Claiming information is shown. Eligible Org has . Example:
-Claimed by: MIA 8/11/2016 12:58
-TB 8/11/2016 12:32
-LAA 8/11/2016 12:46
-TOR 8/11/2016 12:35
-HOU 8/10/2016 16:16
-NYY 8/11/2016 12:44
(Results of request bulletin 1003347 dated Tue 08/09/2016 which expired on Thu 08/11/2016)
AND Bottom of email should contain -
"ALL WAIVER INFORMATION IS TO REMAIN STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL. DO NOT FORWARD THIS INFORMATION. VIOLATIONS MAY RESULT IN FINES OR OTHER DISCIPLINE. End of Bulletin *"

title: BOC user wants to send Waiver Result Bulletin to Club users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and attempting to send a Waiver Result Bulletin
AND Send Emails" is set to "YES"
AND "Send Notification" is checked off under "Result Bulletin" for Club users
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Result Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result bulletin with "Send Notification" selected for Clubs that have Result Bulletin - Send Notification selected. All Waiver Requests will be included
AND Subject of the emails should be "mm/dd/yyyy Wvr Res Bulletin" with the Request Date displayed
AND Top of email should display (with proper bulletin #and dates populated):
-MLB - Waiver Result Bulletin
-Full Club Name (Ex: Los Angeles Dodgers)
AND The remainder of the email should be broken out into two sections. Each section only appears if it is relevant to the Club
AND bulletin should display a "Results" section that details the results for any requests that the viewing Org submitted. If none were submitted for this request date, this should not be displayed. Format as follows:
Results of request bulletin 1003347 dated Tue 08/09/2016 which expired on Thu 08/11/2016
-Format of each result should be:
-Player Last, Player First M.I. - Type (ex:TRD)
-{Waiver Result}
AND if player was not claimed, Waiver Result should match what is displayed on the Results section for BOC (ex: Secured through end of the Championship Season)
BUT if player was claimed, then Claiming information should be shown. Eligible Org has . 
Example:
-Claimed by: MIA 8/11/2016 12:58
-TB 8/11/2016 12:32
-LAA 8/11/2016 12:46
-TOR 8/11/2016 12:35
-HOU 8/10/2016 16:16
-NYY 8/11/2016 12:44
AND after the Request section, a section should appear detailing the results of any Claims that the Org made, if any
BUT if no claims were made by the Org then this section does not appear. Format as follows:
Results of your claims from request bulletin 1003347 dated Tue 08/09/2016 which expired on Thu 08/11/2016
-Player Last, Player First M.I. - Type (ex:TRD)
-{Waiver Claim Result}
AND Bottom of email should contain -
"ALL WAIVER INFORMATION IS TO REMAIN STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL. DO NOT FORWARD THIS INFORMATION. VIOLATIONS MAY RESULT IN FINES OR OTHER DISCIPLINE. End of Bulletin *"

title: User wants PDF of Results Bulletin attached to the email they receive
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as Club or BOC
AND email addresses have been entered in Waivers section of email utility for BOC and one or more clubs
custom_steps: WHEN a Waiver Result Bulletin is sent
custom_expected:
THEN Waiver Results email received by BOC and Club users entered on email utility should have a PDF of the day's bulletin attached 
AND if there is no requests on the request bulletin, no email should be send out.

title: BOC user wants resending notifications for Request Bulletin to also resend email notifications
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and viewing the waivers screen
AND user has selected a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
AND user sees the "Resend Notification Emails" button on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Resend Notification Emails" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should open a pop-up where the user should be able to select the type of notification emails to resend, and the Org(s) it should be resent to
AND clicking "Resend" with "Request" selected should NOT store any changes made to the form or update the stored bulletin, but should generate a new set of notifications for the selected recipients, as well generate a new email for the selected recipients according to the same rules used in the original "Send Request Bulletin" story (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128626185)

title: BOC user wants resending notifications for Result Bulletin to also resend email notifications
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and viewing the waivers screen
AND user has selected a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
AND the corresponding Results Bulletin for this request has also been sent 
AND user sees the "Resend Notification Emails" button on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Resend Notification Emails" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should open a pop-up where the user should be able to select the type of notification emails to resend, and the Org(s) it should be resent to
AND Clicking "Resend" with "Result" selected will NOT store any changes made to the form or update the stored bulletin, but will generate a new set of notifications for the selected recipients, as well generate a new email for the selected recipients according to the same rules used in the original "Send Result Bulletin" stories (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/126758579, https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128679367)

title: BOC User can create the Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps:
WHEN the transaction bulletin is in View or Edit mode
AND clicking the SEND Bulletin button
custom_expected:
THEN it will save any changes made, take the current Pending Bulletin and build the Transaction Bulletin - assigning it an ID and adding it to the "Date" dropdown at the top of the page as "{Current Date} - {Transaction ID#}"
AND any transactions that are checked as "Hold" will NOT be added to the new bulletin
AND will instead roll to the next Pending bulletin
AND the "Hold" checkbox will remain checked
AND a new Pending bulletin will be created and be available in the "Date" dropdown

title: Bulletin Email should contain PDF attachment if there are Entries
custom_preconds: GIVEN there are entries on the Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_steps:
WHEN user Sends or Resends bulletin
AND user is on email list
custom_expected: THEN user will receive an email with a PDF attachment

title: As a Club User, I want to Receive an Email the day before the expiration of an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an approved Employee Permission Request exists
AND a batch has been created to generate email notifications
AND current date is the day before the expiration date of the Employee Permission Request
custom_steps: WHEN the batch runs at 11:00 AM on the day prior to the expiration of an Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact User, as well as all users entered as Current(receiving) Club Contacts on the Request and the designated employee negotiator, should receive an email notification
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Expiring Soon
**Content:** The employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] is set to expire on [End Date] at [End Time]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Club User, I want to Receive an Email the day before the expiration of an Extension Period on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an approved Employee Permission Request exists
AND an Extension request has been approved for it
AND a batch has been created to generate email notifications
AND current date is the day before the Extension Period Expiration on the request
custom_steps: WHEN the batch runs at 11:00 AM
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact User, as well as all users entered as Current(receiving) Club Contacts on the Request and the designated employee negotiator should receive an email notification:
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Expiring Soon
**Content:** The extension period on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] is set to expire on [Extension End Date] at [Extensions End Time]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring User, I want to Receive an Email if an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Denied
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has submitted an Employee Permission Request
custom_steps: WHEN the Employee Permission Request is denied
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user should receive an email notification:
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Denied
**Content:** The employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] has been denied. Please log into EBIS to review
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Receive an Email if an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Approved
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has submitted an employee permission request
custom_steps: WHEN the Employee Permission Request is approved
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user, should receive an email notification
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Approved
**Content:** The employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] has been approved. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring User, I want to Receive an Email if an Extension Request on an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Denied
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been requested for it
custom_steps: WHEN the Extension Request is denied
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user should receive an email notification:
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Extension Request Denied
**Content:** **Content:** The extension for [Employee First] [Employee Last]'s employee permission request has been denied.  Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Receive an Email if an Extension Request on an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Approved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been requested for it
custom_steps: WHEN the Extension Request is approved
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user should receive an email notification:
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Extension Request Approved
**Content:** The extension for [Employee First] [Employee Last]'s employee permission request has been approved.  Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email every 24 hours if I have not Approved or Denied an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an employee permission request has been submitted
AND the request has NOT been approved or denied
AND a batch has been created to send notifications
custom_steps: WHEN the batch runs
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), should receive an email notification 
AND the batch should run and generate the notifications every day at 11:00 AM
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** New Employee Permission Request
**Content:** A new employee permission requests has been submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request
AND the reminder emails should continue until the request is approved, denied, or expires

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email if a Resolution is entered on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps: WHEN a resolution is entered on the Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), should receive an email notification
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Resolution Entered on Employee Permission Request
**Content:** A resolution has been entered on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email if an Extension is Requested on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Active Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps: WHEN an extension is requested on the Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), should receive an email notification
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Extension Requested on Employee Permission Request
**Content:** An extension has been requested on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email if a Post Extension Resolution is entered on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been requested and granted for it
custom_steps: WHEN the post extension resolution is entered
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), will receive an email notification
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Post Extension Resolution Entered on Employee Permission Request
**Content:** A post extension resolution has been entered on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to add Club Contacts to an Employee Permission Request after the request has been approved
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Approved Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps:
WHEN an Admin user from the Receiving Club logs in
AND the user navigates to the approved request
custom_expected:
THEN user should see an Edit button when a request submitted to them is in Active or Active (Ext) state
AND clicking the Edit button should load the form into edit mode
AND the only fields available for the Receiving Club to edit while the request is in Active or Active (Ext) should be the Current Club contacts
AND the user should be able to add new contacts and delete or change existing contacts

title: As User, I want to receive an email when a player is approaching the Two-Way Player threshold
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC/Club
custom_steps: WHEN a player is considered to be approaching (15 IP or 15 GS)
custom_expected:
THEN the system will send an email to the player's club as members of the BOC and indicated on the email utility:
- Subject: Player Approaching Two-Way Player Threshold
- Content: [Player Roster First] [Player Last] is approaching the threshold for Two-Way Player designation. Please log into EBIS to review and contact BOC with any questions or concerns.

AND the email will contain a link to the Two-Way Player Utility

title: As User, I want to receive an email when a player crosses the Two-Way Player threshold
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC/Club
custom_steps: WHEN a player has crossed the threshold for two-way player designation (20 IP and 20 GS)
custom_expected:
THEN the system will send an email to the player's club and members of the BOC as indicated on the email utility:
- Subject: Player Has Reached Two-Way Player Threshold
- Content: [Player Roster First] [Player Last] has satisfied the criteria for being designated a Two-Way Player.

In the event that you would like [Player Roster First] [Player Last] to officially be considered a Two-Way Player per the Major League Rules, you must contact BOC to make that change. Until BOC has approved the change, [Player Last] will continue to be considered a (BOC Position) for the purposes of pitcher and position player roster limits.

AND the email will contain a link to the Two-Way Player Utility

title: As a Club user I want to receive an email when a new user has been approved for my Org
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Need to add this to the email utility. 
* When a new user is approved for a Club in Self Reg, an email is triggered to the Club Admins that a new user has been added to their Org in ebis.
* The content of the email should be:

*First Name Last Name (username)* has been granted access to EBIS as a member of the *ORG* organization. To complete the setup of this user account, please go HERE and grant the user access to the features desired. 

Thank you,

The EBIS Team

* The HERE should be replaced with https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/utilities/user-accounts
* Note that if first/last are too difficult to pull here we can just use the username.

title: Club user wants to receive Action Item if a Transfer to 60-Day IL tx is still missing "SFD" attachment 3 days after entered Transfer Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a submitted or approved "Transfer to 60-Day IL (MJ)" tx exists for a player
AND the tx does NOT have an attachment with label "Standard Form of Diagnosis" attached
AND  Transfer Date on the tx is three or more days before current date
AND form does NOT have "Received SDF" checkbox checked
custom_steps: WHEN the "Nightly Notifications" batch is run
custom_expected:
THEN an action item should be generated for the Club MJ Transactions Admin according to clipboard requirements
AND clicking "Description" hyperlink on the item should open the transfer to 60-day IL transaction in edit mode in the same window/tab
AND clicking player name hyperlink on the item should open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab

title: Receive email when player requires a IL Recert
custom_preconds: GIVEN users email is listed on the Email Utility
custom_steps:
WHEN player is placed on the IL who requires a Recertification
AND system checks to see if "Send Emails" is set to Yes. 
AND system checks to see if "Send Notification" is checked for Clubs for the "IL E-recerts" under the Transactions section of the Email Utility. 
AND system also checks to see if "Send Notification" is checked for the BOC for the "IL E-recerts" under the Transactions section of the Email Utility.
custom_expected:
THEN user should receive email
AND notification is generated for Club

title: Club receives email when a player is missing an SFD
custom_preconds: GIVEN users email is listed on the Email Utility
custom_steps:
WHEN player is placed on the IL 4 days ago without the Received SFD checkbox checked
AND system checks to see if "Send Emails" is set to Yes. 
AND system checks to see if "Send Notification" is checked for Clubs for the "SFD Overdue Emails" under the Transactions section of the Email Utility. 
AND system also checks to see if "Send Notification" is checked for the BOC for the "SFD Overdue Emails" under the Transactions section of the Email Utility.
custom_expected:
THEN user should receive email
AND notification is generated for Club

title: As a Club user I want to send an email containing Sign Up instructions to a new user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=request_new_user

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user is viewing the new User Accounts utility, there is a hyperlink that reads "Request New User".
* Clicking "Request New User" will prompt the user to enter the First Name, Last Name and email address of the new user being requested. 
* When the user clicks "Send", ebis will generate an email to the email address entered with a Subject line of "EBIS Access Request" and the following content:

Dear *First Name* *Last Name*-

You are receiving this email because your Club recently requested a new EBIS account for you. You'll need to complete the following before you are able to access EBIS (https://ebis.mlb.com).

Complete the EBIS User Registration Form HERE as soon as possible. MLB will not be able to grant your request for access until you finish this step. Once you complete the EBIS User Registration Form you'll receive two emails: the first is confirmation that we received your request, the second is that it was approved.

AFTER you receive the second email confirmation you'll need to click on the link in that email to create your password.

Finally, after your account password has been created, you'll need to set up MLB's Okta Multifactor authentication app on your mobile device. Instructions on how to do that are available HERE.

If you have any questions please contact your Club's Baseball Operations department.

Thank you,

The EBIS Team


* The "HERE" for ebis user registration will be this link: https://clubhouse.mlb.com/UserRegistrationForm/?GROUP=EBIS2.0

* The "HERE" for the Okta instructions will be this link: https://mlb.app.box.com/s/lzvyo3a2ma4s05nga9g8ujl4s5z88u55

title: As a BOC user I want to send an email containing Sign Up instructions to a new user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=request_new_user

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing the new User Accounts utility, there is a hyperlink that reads "Request New User".
* Clicking "Request New User" will prompt the user to enter the First Name, Last Name and email address of the new user being requested. 
* When the user clicks "Send", ebis will generate an email to the email address entered with a Subject line of "EBIS Access Request" and the following content:

Dear *First Name* *Last Name*-

You are receiving this email because the Commissioner's Office recently requested a new EBIS account for you. You'll need to complete the following before you are able to access EBIS (https://ebis.mlb.com).

Complete the EBIS User Registration Form HERE as soon as possible. MLB will not be able to grant your request for access until you finish this step. Once you complete the EBIS User Registration Form you'll receive two emails: the first is confirmation that we received your request, the second is that it was approved.

AFTER you receive the second email confirmation you'll need to click on the link in that email to create your password.

Finally, after your account password has been created, you'll need to set up MLB's Okta Multifactor authentication app on your mobile device. Instructions on how to do that are available HERE.

If you have any questions please contact the Baseball Operations department.

Thank you,

The EBIS Team


* The "HERE" for ebis user registration will be this link: https://clubhouse.mlb.com/UserRegistrationForm/?GROUP=EBIS2.0

* The "HERE" for the Okta instructions will be this link: https://mlb.app.box.com/s/lzvyo3a2ma4s05nga9g8ujl4s5z88u55

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete an account from ebis
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=delete_user

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a BOC user with user accounts edit permissions is editing or viewing an individual user's account, there is a "Delete" button.
* Clicking the button will open a modal asking the user to confirm that they wish to delete the account, and allowing them to also specify if they want to request Account removal from all systems. 
* If the user does not indicate that they wish submit a ticket to deactivate the account and they click "Confirm", then the system will remove the relevant user id from all ebis related LDAPs, including ebis-user. 
* The system will display a blue success notification indicating that the user was deleted from ebis, and the user will be returned to the main User Accounts screen.
* If the user indicates that they wish to delete the account and also submit a ticket to deactivate the account and they click "Confirm", then the system will remove the relevant user id from all ebis related LDAPs, including ebis-user AND generate an email to bocservicedesk@mlb.com with a request to deactivate the selected account. The email should be sent from the logged in user's email address, with the subject "Disable User Account" and in the body of the email the following should appear: 
 - "Please disable all accounts for *username*."
* A blue success message displays when the email has been successfully sent.

title: As a Club  user I want to be able to delete an account from ebis
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=delete_user

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a Club user with user accounts edit permissions is editing or viewing an individual user's account, there is a "Delete" button.
* Clicking the button will open a modal asking the user to confirm that they wish to delete the account, and allowing them to also specify if they want to request Account removal from all systems. 
* If the user does not indicate that they wish submit a ticket to deactivate the account and they click "Confirm", then the system will remove the relevant user id from all ebis related LDAPs, including ebis-user. 
* The system will display a blue success notification indicating that the user was deleted from ebis, and the user will be returned to the main User Accounts screen.
* If the user indicates that they wish to delete the account and also submit a ticket to deactivate the account and they click "Confirm", then the system will remove the relevant user id from all ebis related LDAPs, including ebis-user AND generate an email to bocservicedesk@mlb.com with a request to deactivate the selected account. The email should be sent from the logged in user's email address, with the subject "Disable User Account" and in the body of the email the following should appear: 
 - "Please disable all accounts for *username*."
* A blue success message displays when the email has been successfully sent.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to email uploaded files in bulk
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user navigates to the File Attachments utility
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks "Generate Email"
AND clicks  " " after entering the required details, the system will email the selected file(s) to the designated email address(es)
custom_expected:
THEN new pop-up enabling the user to enter the desired email address(es) to send the selected files, as well as a subject line and a brief message 
AND The emails should appear as though they are coming directly from the user using the utility (the username)
AND user should be able to send emails for any type or combination of params available on the utility

title: As a user I want to be able to quickly email an attachment to someone
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants to quickly email an attachment to someone
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks on the email icon 
AND after filling in required fields clicks "Send"
custom_expected:
THEN a pop-up for the user to enter in the desired email address(es), subject and body of an email
AND Subject should default to "Last, First - Label" with the "Label" being the selected label on the attached file
AND clicking "send" will email the uploaded file to the entered address(es)
AND The email will in some way indicate that it is being sent on behalf of the user, and not just "ebis"
